unit.utterance: ca šːilcːeb ca kulpat, χula kulpat bužibcab, iltːacːer ca rursːi ružibcar har zamana kːušle aluqːan.
unit.utterance_translation: In one village there lived a family, a big family. They had a girl who was hungry all the time and was insatiable.

unit.utterance: čula χudaj lukːan χurejg ilil χudaj lukːunneda rik'ul cinni dukunne dužible heltːi.
unit.utterance_translation: The food that was given to the dogs, she said, "I will give it to the dogs", but apparently she ate it herself.

unit.utterance: q'ʷila χula reʁibqːel, arin kːušle χalq' bukːan agurcar, aždaha agurcar helicːer.
unit.utterance_translation: When she grow older a little, she got so hungry that she ate people and turned into a monster.

unit.utterance: berkuncab cinna kulpat, c'il berkuncab libil šːante, ca admi waturre cinna culbe dumkːa dirq'an.
unit.utterance_translation: She ate up her family, then she ate up all fellow villagers, leaving alive only one person to sharpen her teeth with.

unit.utterance: il rursːila užibcaw ucːi ħaˁlt'ilew.
unit.utterance_translation: This girl had a brother who was working somewhere else.

unit.utterance: hel saˁq'aˁn zamana, čula šːa zunra šːante bik'ulcab, u abdaldew? maˁq'aˁtːa!
unit.utterance_translation: When he went back, the villagers of the neighbouring village said: "Are you a fool? Don't go!"

unit.utterance: ala rucːi aždaha agurre, libil berkuncab, čak'al wilakːu, ura ukːanden maˁq'aˁtːa bik'ulcab.
unit.utterance_translation: Your sister turned into a monster, she ate them all, no one is left, and she will eat you, don't go!", they said.

unit.utterance: durħuˁ wiχči aagurre, agurcaw.
unit.utterance_translation: The boy did not believe and went there.

unit.utterance: šːilcːew erik'ulcaw čak'al caʔarah admi wakːu.
unit.utterance_translation: He looks around in the village, but no one was there, no person.

unit.utterance: qili wiagurcaw ler cinna hel rucːi,
unit.utterance_translation: He went into his home, and there was his sister.

unit.utterance: rucːira razi riχubcar, ilra šakičibcaw itːi χalq' bik'ʷan mar burkːar ik'ul, ilicːe cik'al haʔiblekːu.
unit.utterance_translation: His sister was happy, and he also guessed that the people had probably said the truth, but he didn't say anything to her.

unit.utterance: rucːi razi riχuble, hana du sarirʁandan rik'ulcar u kajžible uže.
unit.utterance_translation: The sister was happy: "I have come now," she said, "sit down."

unit.utterance: agurcar rucːi tːura.
unit.utterance_translation: The sister went outside.

unit.utterance: hel zamana tːura habeʁibcab cinna qilir waca.
unit.utterance_translation: At this time a mouse came out of its house.

unit.utterance: abdaldew u, bik'ulcab wacara, ala rucːi aždaha agurcar, libil χalq' ašːala kulpat berkːun, libil šːante berkːun hana ura ukːande.
unit.utterance_translation: "Are you a fool?", said the mouse as well, "Your sister became a monster, ate all the people and your family, ate all the villagers, and now she will eat you."

unit.utterance: heχ cinna culbe dumkːa darq'ij agur bik'ulcab waca.
unit.utterance_translation: "She went to sharpen her teeth" said the mouse.

unit.utterance: na ilij wiχči agurre durħuˁ saruquncaw.
unit.utterance_translation: Now the boy believed it and run away.

unit.utterance: duc'ik'ul, duc'ik'ul, eritːi sark'ul lerel rucːi rakːujal ik'ul hel.
unit.utterance_translation: He ran and ran, looked around, wondering whether his sister is there or not.

unit.utterance: hekle cara šːi bužibcab heltːu duc' ik'ul užibcaw.
unit.utterance_translation: The other village was close, so he ran there apparently.

unit.utterance: ca zamana eritːi sark'ulcaw: duc' rik'ul c'al purχ rik'ul hitːi ruqunne rucːi saˁq'uˁnne.
unit.utterance_translation: At one time he looks around, and sees: his sister was running behind him spitting fire.

unit.utterance: hatira χʷalle duc'ik'ul il, čidažibcad ʡaˁbal kːalkːi, heltːašːu duc'ik'ul.
unit.utterance_translation: And he ran even faster, saw three trees and ran to them.

unit.utterance: agurre hel bah čisariʁan zamana rucːi, čihawquncaw hel kːalkːilcːe.
unit.utterance_translation: When his sister almost got up to him, he went up a tree.

unit.utterance: bah qari agurre kːalkːila kajžibcaw.
unit.utterance_translation: He went up to the top and stayed in the tree.

unit.utterance: hel rucːil raʔrišːibcar bukːunne kːalkːi kabikaraj.
unit.utterance_translation: The sister started to eat up the tree so it would fall down.

unit.utterance: durħuˁ waʔašːibcaw xʷit'ik'ul, waˁw ik'ʷij šːilcːed χudaj.
unit.utterance_translation: The boy began to whistle and to cry to the dogs in the village.

unit.utterance: kːalkːi kabičaqibcab; t'am daq'iblekːu χudaj ilila xʷit'ra.
unit.utterance_translation: The tree fell down, and the dogs didn't hear his sound or whistling.

unit.utterance: il duc'uquncaw c'il cara kːalkːilšːu witeʁaraj.
unit.utterance_translation: He then ran to another tree to reach it.

unit.utterance: čihawquncaw il kːalkːij, hitːiruqunne.
unit.utterance_translation: He climbed up that tree and she followed.

unit.utterance: c'il il kːalkːira bukːunne raʔašːibcar, il durħuˁ xʷit'ik'ul waˁw ik'ul χudaj.
unit.utterance_translation: Then she began to eat that tree, and the boy whistled and cried to the dogs.

unit.utterance: c'ilra t'am baq'iblekːu iltːi χudaj il kːalkːira kabičaqibcab hel aždahal.
unit.utterance_translation: Those dogs didn't hear those sounds this time either, and the monster made the tree fall.

unit.utterance: cara kːalkːilij čihawquncaw, ilil aždahal il kːalkːira bukːunne kabičaqaraj.
unit.utterance_translation: He went up another tree, so the monster also ate that tree so it would fall down.

unit.utterance: c'il arin χʷalle na cara kːalkːira akːʷarqːel, waˁw ik'ul, c'aq'le waˁw ik'ul hel durħuˁ, xʷit' ik'ul, t'am daq'ibcad heltːi χudaj.
unit.utterance_translation: Then because there was no other tree left that was so strong, the boy cried and cried very loudly, and whistled, and the dogs heard him.

unit.utterance: bah hel kːalkːi kabirkan zamana čisadeʁibcad χude.
unit.utterance_translation: When this tree already felt down, the dogs were coming.

unit.utterance: čiduqunne hel aždahaj bebč'aqibcab aždaha.
unit.utterance_translation: They threw themselves onto this monster and killed it.

unit.utterance: razi iχuble il durħuˁra čirkawqunne qaˁškaʁibcar hel aždaha.
unit.utterance_translation: The boy got happy, came down and cut this monster into pieces.

unit.utterance: bah nik'a t'uplicːer cinna atːa aba tːurahaqːibcab, helsat χːula reʁible ružible hel rucːi.
unit.utterance_translation: From her little finger he pulled out his parents, so big was his sister.

unit.utterance: k'ult'a qaˁškaʁible libil šːante tːurahaqːibcab.
unit.utterance_translation: He cut open the belly, and pulled out all fellow villagers.

unit.utterance: ilil č'aˁmbirq'ul bužiblekːu xurt'iʁul bužibcab χalq'.
unit.utterance_translation: It turned out that she did not chew, but apparently swallowed the people.

unit.utterance: tːurahaqːible heltːi šːantera, libil razil barkalla bik'ul.
unit.utterance_translation: (The boy) pulled all the fellow villagers out. All thanked him happily.

unit.utterance: hel durħuˁj bah qːuʁa rursːira dik'ar rarq'ible helij c'ikuri, meq barq'ible kabižibcab.
unit.utterance_translation: They chose the most beautiful girl for the boy as bride, and organized a wedding.

unit.utterance: dura het meqlew kelgunda učːul ukunne.
unit.utterance_translation: I have been to this wedding as well, I ate and drank.
